Name: Posting of signs at construction sites.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the posting of signs at construction sites.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 

Section 1.  Section BC 3301 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 33 for the year 2007, is amended by adding a new section 3301.9.2.1 to read as follows:
3301.9.2.1 Construction site safety signs.  There shall be posted at each site where construction-, excavation- or demolition-related activities in one or more areas readily visible to workers at such site, signs informing them of their right to report conditions at such site that endanger such workers or the general public.  Such signs shall be in English, Spanish, Chinese, Hebrew, Urdu, Arabic, Polish, Russian and Haitian Creole and in such other languages as the commissioner deems appropriate. These signs shall provide a telephone number independent of the 311 service center where such reports may be made, must state that such reports may be made anonymously and that callers will not be asked their immigration status and contain such other information as the commissioner shall require.  
 ยง2. This local law shall take effect on July 1, 2008.
